intro: Rodriguezia limae, commonly known as the Guiana Shield tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is enclosed in a fleshy, yellowish aril. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
